div.head: 28.5.1885 Donnerstag
div.p: Started for the Trollhätta at 7.10 this morning. The whole way there thought about Kristiania. Very nice gentleman in carriage with us. scenery very pretty on the way (there). At Station Trollhätta at 10. First eat some execrably bad ragout at Hotel Trollhättan, then took a little boy to lead us to the Cataracts. First he took us to the Locks. All one above the other. Then along the Göta Elfe which here winds though rocks covered with pines. Very soon we heard the noise of the first cataract. The whole rapids are over a mile long. The first is the smallest, but very fine. The boy took us to a tower from which we had a view over the whole rapids, then down to the old lock which is now a very pretty waterfall. From there to the large cataract. The Göta Elf is here about twice as broad as the Seine. We went over a bridge, the fall nearly deafening me, on to a little island in the middle of the cataracts. On both sides the water surges and boils up as if it was lushed by a gigantic whip. It is impossible to describe the roar with with this enormous mass of water bounds down over the rocks, nor the beauty of the scenery. One could sit there hours and look at it and always find new beauties. Especially on the bridges the scene is indescribably grand: the bare rocks with here and there a pine, rising out of the foam which splashes and bounds around them as though it would swallow them up in its seething bosom. After a while we went up one of the colossal boulders which stud the country but lost our way and had to go down and get the boy to lead us, This he did and we had a magnificent view of the whole falls, but not to be compared to the indescribably grand scene from the bridge below. From here he led us back to the Hotel, where we had some beer and coffee and aunt Lulu bought some Knackebrö. At 3 we got into the carriage and drove to the station where we had to wait some time before the train started. As we came into Gothenburg we saw a large fire and when we got out the whole town was running that way. The only cab in the place was taken away from us before our very noses by another man so that we had with the really dreadful shawlpacket to walk to the Uffo. The captain promised to wait a quarter of an hour for us. But with our general luck here again the one cab was taken by a family with a lot of trunks before we could get it, so that we again had to walk. Aunt Lulu gave the shawlpacket a boy to carry and he of course lost her waterproof over which she lamented dreadfully and began to cry. We at last got a cab and drove to the Hotel where we packed everything in a dreadful hurry, but of course missed the Uffo over which aunt Lulu again began to cry. However I managed to calm her and we had dinner, an abominable beefsteak at the Göta Källare. From here we went to the same garden we had been at the day before and heard the music. At 9.35 after tea and two eggs we started for Malmö in a very nice Coupé. I broke my stick though in getting into the train.
